name: Rohan Shrotri
title: Full Stack Web Developer
description: Full stack developer specializing in Node, MongoDB and Express looking for a new software development opportunity. Currently employed as an IT professional with three years of experience in a corporate environment. Additional programming experience is with C/C++, Python and JavaScript.

professional_experience.title: Datacenter Technician
details: Demonstrated general knowledge proficiency with computing and telecommunications equipment.
Deployed inventoried and maintained systems availability for servers and networking equipment in a datacenter of over 10,000 devices.
Installed rails, fiber, cat5/cat6 copper cabling, servers and switches with accurate labeling, color coding and documentation to meet quality standards.
Provided hands on support to customers, offsite networking and systems teams within IBM SLA.
Displayed a high level of self-sufficiency by performing all critical datacenter operations solo.

professional_experience.title: Service Desk Technician
details: Provided level 1 support for all hardware and software issues directly affecting end users including company PCs, printers and mobile phones
Displayed proficiency in troubleshooting and technical problems solving by fixing undocumented errors.
Consolidated new hire onboarding and PC build process, performed fault diagnosis of faulty systems, and the management of open tickets in company ticketing system.
Demonstrated friendly yet professional demeanor when interacting with customers both in person and on the phone.
Procured and managed inventory of IT/Company equipment

portfolio.title: YelpCamp
portfolio.short_description: A Yelp Clone for viewing and rating campsites
portfolio.description: This is the production application that I created as part of the online web development bootcamp I participated in.

portfolio.title: Ping Pong Scorekeepter
portfolio.short_description: A web application to keep score for anything, really
portfolio.description: A scorekeeping application that I created to get some practice working with Documentation for a technologi I didnt know how to use as well as event handlers
